turns.text: Do you see anything wrong with public school systems
turns.label: qy

turns.text: Well yes I do Um I think Im concerned about the large number of children that each teacher is expected to to deal with in some quality way I think maybe weve given our teachers almost impossible job
turns.label: ny

turns.text: Do you Do you have children in the public school system
turns.label: qy

turns.text: Yes and I taught for fourteen years --
turns.label: ny

turns.text: -- before we moved to Texas and the the one thing I see is changing is I was held accountable so much I had to document and create paper chase for all of my students and instead of spending my time coming up with creative learning stations and things like that I was filling out all these forms --
-- everything had to be documented and I had file cabinets that werent filled with neat stuff for kids it was filled with documentation --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well um Im I have three years toward teaching degree and am trying to get headed back and and Im just really in dilemma if thats what you know - I love to work with children and --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- to teach them but Im really having questions if if I can deal with that system and and have good conscience about you know what I do I dont think I dont think its the teachers I think its the system --
Theyre so worried about lawsuits and the scores the children get on tests now --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- and teacher competency you know and its not like the teacher can just get in there and do her best shes always worried whos looking over her shoulder and -
What childs going to say something --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- some parents going to overreact to --
-- thats thats true Well its its hard on the children too I think you know because the um the teachers are overworked and just like mommy thats overworked --
turns.label: aa

turns.text: -- youre not at your best you know um
Do you have children in the system
turns.label: qy

turns.text: I have two I have in the system - one is in ninth grade and one is in seventh grade and them - um Im home schooling my kindergartner this year
turns.label: na

turns.text: We um live in district that has open classrooms and I wasnt particularly comfortable with that for her
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And I have one in ninth grade at Clark and one at Hendrick this year and he my nin- my uh sixth grader came from an open classroom at Matthews and the very first year I taught back in seventy-three we had open classroom and it didnt work then --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and when we moved down here I was just appalled that they were still doing --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well the explanation I was was given about you know - they they seemed to admit that it wasnt working but they didnt have the money to restructure but looks to me that it wouldnt take really that much money to at least come up with I mean some kind of partitions --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- or just to face the children different directions or to do something --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- I know last year my son had to eat in the classroom because there was no cafeteria at his school --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- in this one large open area so I didnt really care for that It seems like the schools in Michigan were much better than they are down here
That was our last tour in Michigan
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well we were from North um Carolina and of course North North Carolina has terrible reputation as far as education I think they rank about forty-ninth --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- but our children got very good education there --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- they were in the magnet school program and lot of their classes from the time they were about third grade they they changed classes several times during the day which has its pros and cons but lot of their classes there were only eight or ten children in their classes --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- so you know Im coming to to Plano thinking Well gosh its going to be really great its ranked so much better
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: Yes thats right We heard wonderful things about it until we actually got in the system
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Isnt that interesting I I I dont understand how they get this this reputation unless its just that they spend lot of money I dont know
turns.label: ba

turns.text: Probably so on publicity and letting realtors know and key people how wonderful the schools are --
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Well my son is at Clark this year too so uh were -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh hes pleased with his classes I I I dont guess Ive been in the high school long enough to to know what to expect really --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- you know how to judge it
My daughter seems to be having good time she was absent with strep throat the last three days and I ran over and picked up her report card and she did very good so --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and she seems to be studying and has just about the right amount of home work I would expect --
-- for freshman to have Shes not bogged down but yet she has some every night
Well Eric seems to have quite few nights where he doesnt have any so thats interesting but he his grades I havent seen them yet but supposedly theyre good so -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yes you always hear how good Now my sons at junior high and says that his grades are going to be wonderful but who knows what hes going to bring home
turns.label: b
